message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CL. 

The paper focuses on neural network training and generalization, which are core topics in machine learning. The use of stiffness as a concept to measure generalization is a novel approach, which suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper studies the stiffness of fully-connected and convolutional neural networks on image datasets such as MNIST, FASHION MNIST, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. The paper also investigates the effect of learning rate and training iteration on stiffness, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. The paper's focus on characterizing generalization and diagnosing neural network training suggests that it may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Finally, the paper's use of natural language processing techniques to analyze the stiffness of neural networks suggests that it may also belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category.
